name: Panties
description: We know what menstruation is, what it looks like. But what’s surround it?. Those days come with (or because of) a certain kind of things that forms kind of a domestic ritual, a kit for survival while we bleed out.   I have polycystic ovaries and for me, if I don’t take any pills, the menstruation is more an absence than a presence. Not having it for so much time has made me see it in another way, like something abnormal, and that’s when I can analyze it better, because I know what it is to have it, but I’ve also had the distance to see it from above. Now that I’m taking contraception and it forces my body to menstruate, my relationship with it has been different, like an special event that even if I don’t romanticize it, still is special.
